text: this guy has some serious skills: <https://codepen.io/finnhvman/pen/xJRMJp>

Don't forget your can filter with CSS as well, you do not need to use js... <https://preview.hs-sites.com/_hcms/preview/template/multi?portalId=2359872&tc_deviceCategory=desktop&domain=default&template_file_path=custom%2Fpage%2FDEV_IMPRV%2Fhubdb_css_filter.html>

I have used something like that in production before. my boss went: “why, just why” I said “for the 0.000001% of people who disable javascript.  the rest of the page may fail but my tabs/filtering, that will still work”

Hey dear community
I need to access to an external JSON file that contains RATINGS of a product to print this ratings in microdatas on a website page

I have a 403 error cause I believe it’s forbidden to use CORS in HubSpot environment

Do you have any solution to bypath this problem ?

if you can't modify the CORS policy in the external server maybe you can use JSONP instead:
`$.getJSON( “<https://external.json?jsoncallback=>?”, function( data ) {`
`    console.log(“Hello JSON”); `
`});`
Do you have admin access to the server that you are trying to get the JSON from <@U3TR96G84> ?

hey <@U25PYL3Q8> nope I can’t. It’s an URL from a external API that send a JSON as response. That’s my issue. Do you confirm that it’s not possible to use JSON in a jQuery script in a custom module for example ?
